pages.text: Ophthalmosaurus is a Jurassic ichthyosaur whose genus name means "Eye Lizard", was named in 1874 by Harry Govier Seeley after the proportionally huge eye sockets in the cranium of the animal. Considered a generalist thanks to the intermediate shape of the teeth compared to its relatives, this animal probably fed on smaller fish and cephalopods which it hunted in the shallow waters it lived in.
